vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Windows Information Disclosure
vulnerabilities.description: Memory leak in Desktop Window Manager allowing exploit mitigation bypass.

vulnerabilities.title: WordPress Ecosystem
vulnerabilities.description: Modular DS Plugin authentication bypass; grants full Admin access.

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Edge (Chromium WebView)
vulnerabilities.description: Script injection into privileged pages via WebView.
vulnerabilities.fix: Update Microsoft Edge to version 143.0.3650.139 or later.

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Windows & Office (January 2026)
vulnerabilities.description: Zero-click Remote Code Execution (RCE) via Outlook/Explorer Preview Pane.
vulnerabilities.fix: Patch Office 2026/365. Workaround: Disable the Preview Pane.

vulnerabilities.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager
vulnerabilities.description: Cisco Unified Communications Products Code Injection Vulnerability.
vulnerabilities.fix: Cisco has released the software updates and patch files to address the vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Word Remote Code Execution
vulnerabilities.description: Code execution via malicious Word documents.

vulnerabilities.title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) OneView
vulnerabilities.description: Unauthenticated RCE on HPE OneView instances.

vulnerabilities.title: Versa Concerto
vulnerabilities.fix: Update to Versa Concerto 12.2.1 GA (released April 16, 2025).

vulnerabilities.title: Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite (ZCS)
vulnerabilities.description: Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite (ZCS) PHP Remote File Inclusion Vulnerability.
vulnerabilities.fix: Upgrade immediately to a patched version.

vulnerabilities.title: Gogs
vulnerabilities.fix: Upgrade to Gogs v0.13.0 or later.

vulnerabilities.title: Vite Vitejs
vulnerabilities.description: Vite Development Server Arbitrary File Access Vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: Bluetooth Ecosystem
vulnerabilities.description: "WhisperPair" vulnerabilities allow attackers to hijack audio devices and eavesdrop due to improper pairing logic checks.
vulnerabilities.fix: Awaiting vendor patches; disable auto-pairing features if available.

vulnerabilities.title: State-Sponsored Exploitation (Sitecore)
vulnerabilities.description: China-linked hackers (UAT-8837) exploited this zero-day for initial access into North American critical infrastructure.
vulnerabilities.fix: Apply Sitecore patches and look for IOCs related to "Earthworm" trojan.

vulnerabilities.title: Prettier eslint-config-prettier
vulnerabilities.description: Prettier eslint-config-prettier Embedded Malicious Code Vulnerability.
vulnerabilities.fix: Remove compromised package versions and audit dependencies.

vulnerabilities.title: Microsoft Office PowerPoint Code Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Memory corruption vulnerability allowing remote code execution via malicious PowerPoint files. Still actively exploited in the wild.
vulnerabilities.fix: Install Patch MS09-017. Consider blocking legacy Office file formats.
